windows.name: Oops!
description:
Warning

It's not possible to run a iOS mobile application on Windows.

mac.name: Install Homebrew
description:
What's this?

Homebrew is a free/open source software package management system that simplifies the installation of software on the Mac OS X operating system. Homebrew has been recommended for its ease of use as well as its integration into the command line.

Installation

To Install Homebrew paste in the Terminal this code:

ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

mac.name: Install Xcode
description:
What's this?

Xcode includes the libraries you need to create and emulate mobile apps for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Watch.

Installation

Download Xcode from the Mac App Store and install it.

mac.name: Install Node.js
description:
What's this?

Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient and his package ecosystem, npm, is the largest ecosystem of open source libraries in the world.

Installation

Download Node.js from here and install it.

mac.name: Install Cordova
description:
What's this?

Apache Cordova is a set of device APIs that allow you to access native device functions, such as the camera or accelerometer from JavaScript.

Installation

To Install Apache Cordova, use the Node Package Manager (npm) provided with Node.js:

    Open the Terminal (start -> run: cmd.exe)
    Run this command:
    npm install -g cordova

mac.name: Install Ionic
description:
What's this?

Ionic provide a command line layer to build mobile hybrid apps using HTML5 and AngularJS. Ionic also provide a complete front-end stack focused on cross-platform mobile user experience.

Installation

To Install Ionic, use the Node Package Manager (npm) provided with Node.js:

    Open the Terminal
    Run this command:
    npm install -g ionic

NOTE: if NPM command returns an error run sudo npm install -g ionic

mac.name: End
description:
Further information

If you have any further questions, contact us at support@wakanda.io.

windows.name: Install Node.js
description:
What's this?

Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient and his package ecosystem, npm, is the largest ecosystem of open source libraries in the world.

Installation

Download Node.js from here and install it.

Restarting your Wakanda studio is required after this step.

windows.name: Install Cordova
description:
What's this?

Apache Cordova is a set of device APIs that allow you to access native device functions, such as the camera or accelerometer from JavaScript.

Installation

To Install Apache Cordova, use the Node Package Manager (npm) provided with Node.js:

    Open the Terminal (start -> run: cmd.exe)
    Run this command:
    npm install -g cordova

windows.name: Install Ionic
description:
What's this?

Ionic provide a command line layer to build mobile hybrid apps using HTML5 and AngularJS. Ionic also provide a complete front-end stack focused on cross-platform mobile user experience.

Installation

To Install Ionic, use the Node Package Manager (npm) provided with Node.js:

    Open the Terminal
    Run this command:
    npm install -g ionic

NOTE: if NPM command returns an error run sudo npm install -g ionic

windows.name: Install Java JDK
description:
What's this?

Java Standard Edition Development Kit (JDK) is a development environment for building applications, applets, and components using the Java programming language.
The JDK includes tools useful for developing and testing programs written in the Java programming language and running on the Java platform. The JDK includes the JRE, so you do not have to download both separately.

Installation

Download Java Platform JDK from here and install it.

Edit your environment variables

    Add a new user variable named JAVA_HOME with value:
    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-version-folder
    Edit your user variable named PATH adding at start the following text:
    %JAVA_HOME%\bin;

you can find more info here

Restarting your Wakanda studio is required after this step.

windows.name: Install Apache Ant
description:
What's this?

Apache Ant is a Java library and command-line tool whose mission is to drive processes described in build files as targets and extension points dependent upon each other. The main known usage of Ant is the build of Java applications. Ant supplies a number of built-in tasks allowing to compile, assemble, test and run Java applications. Ant can also be used effectively to build non Java applications, for instance C or C++ applications. More generally, Ant can be used to pilot any type of process which can be described in terms of targets and tasks.

Installation

    Download Apache Ant binary files from hereUnzip the folder and move it to your Program Files folder:
    C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.9.6

Edit your environment variables

Edit your user variable named PATH adding at start the following text:

C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.9.6\bin;

you can find more info here

Restarting your Wakanda studio is required after this step.

windows.name: Install Android SDK
description:
What's this?

The Android Software Development Kit (SDK) includes a comprehensive set of development tools. These include a debugger, libraries, a handset emulator based on QEMU, documentation, sample code, and tutorials.

Installation

To install the Android SDK:

    Download the installer from here and run it.Run the SDK manager as suggested at the end of the installation process and install:
    Tools
    Android 5.1.1 (API 22) or newer
    Extras

Edit your environment variables

    Add a new user variable named ANDROID_HOME with value:
    % USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Android\android-sdk
    Edit your user variable named PATH adding at start the following text:
    %ANDROID_HOME%\platform-tools;%ANDROID_HOME%\tools;

you can find more info here

Restarting your Wakanda studio is required after this step.

Additional components

Intel HAXM greatly improves the performances of Android emulator. To run the installer open your command line and run:

"%ANDROID_HOME%\extras\intel\Hardware_Accelerated_Execution_Manager\intelhaxm-android.exe"

more info here

windows.name: Create AVD
description:
What's this?

The AVD Manager provides a graphical user interface in which you can create and manage Android Virtual Devices (AVDs), which are required by the Android Emulator.

Configuration

To configure an emulator:

    Open Android AVD in your command line run:

    "%ANDROID_HOME%\AVD Manager.exe"
    Click Create and create a new virtual machine

more info here

windows.name: End
description:
Further information

If you have any further questions, contact us at support@wakanda.io.

The JDK includes tools useful for developing and testing programs written in the Java programming language and running on the Java platform. The JDK includes the JRE, so you do not have to download both separately.

mac.name: Install Apache Ant
description:
What's this?

Apache Ant is a Java library and command-line tool whose mission is to drive processes described in build files as targets and extension points dependent upon each other. The main known usage of Ant is the build of Java applications. Ant supplies a number of built-in tasks allowing to compile, assemble, test and run Java applications. Ant can also be used effectively to build non Java applications, for instance C or C++ applications. More generally, Ant can be used to pilot any type of process which can be described in terms of targets and tasks.

Installation

To install Apache Ant you can use brew in the Terminal window:

brew install ant

mac.name: Install Android SDK
description:
What's this?

The Android Software Development Kit (SDK) includes a comprehensive set of development tools. These include a debugger, libraries, a handset emulator based on QEMU, documentation, sample code, and tutorials.

Installation

To install the Android SDK:

    Run brew in the Terminal window:

    brew install android-sdk
    Run in the Terminal:
    android
    From the SDK manager install:
    Tools
    Android 5.1.1 (API 22) or newer
    Extras

Additional components

Intel HAXM greatly improves the performances of Android emulator. To run open the following folder:

/usr/local/opt/android-sdk/extras/intel/Hardware_Accelerated_Execution_Manager

and run the dmg installer. More info here

mac.name: Create AVD
description:
What's this?

The AVD Manager provides a graphical user interface in which you can create and manage Android Virtual Devices (AVDs), which are required by the Android Emulator.

Configuration

To configure an emulator:

    Open Android AVD in your command line run:

    android avd
    Click Create and create a new virtual machine

more info here

mac.name: End
description:
Further information

If you have any further questions, contact us at support@wakanda.io.

issues.title: The platform I'm looking for is not listed
description:
We only support iOS and Android for native mobile app development. For other platforms like Windows Phone, you can create a web application with Wakanda and AngularJS.

Send us an email to support@wakanda.io and let us know which platform you need. We'll send you an email when an update is available.

issues.title: npm returns a red error that starts with 'npm ERR! Error: EACCES...'
description:
Solution

Try running the same command prefixed by 'sudo'

Example

instead of

npm install -g ionic

try

sudo npm install -g ionic

issues.title: npm returns a red error that starts with 'npm ERR! network connect ETIMEDOUT...'
description:
Solution

In most cases you are behind a proxy or have bad network settings.
If you are behind a proxy, please make sure that the npm 'proxy' config is set properly.

Example

In the Terminal run

npm config set proxy http://proxy.company.com:8080
npm config set https-proxy http://proxy.company.com:8080

If you are working behind a proxy in a "windows" domain, add the domain name into the proxy url:

npm config set proxy http://domain%5Cuser:password@proxy.company.com:8080
npm config set https-proxy http://domain%5Cuser:password@proxy.company.com:8080

You need to encode the backslash as a http uri string: %5C

Additional information

It could also be necessary to point the npm registry to the http source:

npm config set registry "http://registry.npmjs.org"
npm config set strict-ssl false

issues.title: The iOS emulator displays a blank white screen (OS X El Capitan and Xcode 7)
description:
Solution

Launch Xcode, open its Preferences then download the 'iOS 8.4 Simulator' component from the Downloads tab.

Once done, open the Devices window of Xcode then delete all the '9.0' simulators.

Additionally, you may need to run the following command within your mobile application folder:

ionic state reset
